meanings.definition: Not enviable; not desirable or enjoyable.
meanings.sent1: Living in an unenviable situation can be tough.
meanings.sent2: It is unenviable to be stuck in traffic during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: She found herself in an unenviable position of having to choose between two bad options.
meanings.sent4: The unenviable task of cleaning up after the party fell to him.
meanings.sent5: The unenviable truth was that they had run out of food for the picnic.

meanings.sent1: The unenviable puppy shivered in the cold rain.
meanings.sent2: It was unenviable to see the old man struggling to carry his heavy bags.
meanings.sent3: The unenviable kitten meowed sadly as it searched for its lost toy.
meanings.sent4: She gave an unenviable smile as she recounted her difficult day.
meanings.sent5: The unenviable situation tugged at the heartstrings of all who witnessed it.
